title.narrative: Promoting resource smart green technologies in technical professional and higher education to increase Mozambique's food production and nutrition security

description.narrative: The proposed project must contribute to the following ++objective++: - End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture (SDG 2) The proposed project must contribute to the following ++long-term impacts++: - Promote agricultural growth; - Reduce malnutrition; and - Create ecologically sustainable food systems. The ++medium-term impacts++ that will contribute to this: 1. Education system (TVET/HE) is of good quality, relevant and accessible (SDG 4); 2. Partnerships between persons and organisations are inclusive and sustainable (SDG 17); 3. Organizations key to (sectoral) inclusive development of partner countries are strengthened by inflow of enhanced workforce. ++Outcome++: HE (Higher Education) and TVET (Technical Colleges) organisations (in Mozambique and in NL) perform better their core tasks, and are firmly embedded in their environment (in line with specific labour market needs & aiming at inclusiveness). To that end, the following ++outputs ++must be achieved by the end of the project: 1. Enhanced institutional capacity through hands-on training of teachers, technicians, researchers and students; 2. Increase the quality of agricultural educational programs in Mozambique with an emphasis on hands-on training, inclusiveness & gender, (food) system approach, resilience to climate change, entrepreneurship, and private sector involvement and at the same time enhance collaboration between agricultural research (research institution), Polytechnic education and TVET education to complement each other and share best practices; 3. Established and sustained Centre for Innovation and Resource-Smart Green Technologies adapted to the local context and addressing different needs of the agricultural sector. ​

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 29777, 2502 LT The Hague, The Netherlands

title.narrative: OKP-MOZ-104294 Logical Framework
Strengthening Mozambique’s educational institutes to increase food production and nutrition security
Project photo
A. TVET/HE organisations perform better their core tasks, firmly embedded in their environment
A.E.5. Number of curricula for degree, non-degree and short courses revised/newly developed

description.narrative: Degree: bachelor's, master's and doctorate Non degree: Certificate and diploma

comment.narrative: 30-06-2021: The MSc program has been newly developed with the support from Polytechnic Institute of Bragança (IPB) University of Lisbon, School of Agriculture (ISA). the activity started October 2020 with two groups, one in Portugal (ISA and IPB) and other in Mozambique. The results of the LMNA were studied. The area linked with environment and technological engineering and technology environment was a highlight, and at the end, the MSc proposed is in “Environmental management and sustainable development”. Next step is to submit the proposal to the National Council for Quality Evaluation (Ministry of Education in Mozambique) for a pre-approvement to start the activities. The process can take a year, so the expectation would be to start in 2022.

title.narrative: A.O.10. Diversity in management and teaching staff (i.e. balance in junior/senior staff, women/men, minorities)

description.narrative: please enclose stories of change or examples of best practices

actual.value: Baseline data available of women-men balance for all 3 Institutions through the gender assessment report, ISPM and IMTPAC/IAC both having only 17% representation of female staff on decision-making level and IIAM-CZC 33% female staff representation on decision-making level. For academic staff ISPM is most balanced with 31% female-69% male teachers versus IIAM-CZC and IMTPAC around 20% female-80% male researchers and teachers.

title.narrative: A.O.1. Improved gender equality and gender awareness in the knowledge institution

description.narrative: please enclose stories of change or examples of best practices

actual.value: Gender need assessment carried out at ISPM, IMTPAC and IIAM. Training of 40 IIAM staff members (9 female and 31 male staff) in Chimoio and Sussundenga on Gender and a Gender Unit has been established within IIAM.

title.narrative: A.E.3. Number of staff that have gained qualitative and relevant knowledge and skills to develop and offer the revised/developed study programmes

comment.narrative: 04-01-2022: The capacity development activities have involved a number of staff from the partner organizations: 7 directly in the training for labor market assessment, 6 in the gender assessment, and 2 female administrative staff have benefited from public relations training. Due to the restrictions for mobility and gathering it was not possible to include more people during 2020, but the numbers can be easily reached during 2021, taking into account the activities still planned. 2 PhD students have been also supported with the project.

title.narrative: A.S.1. Number of beneficiaries in the society reached with knowledge, skills and techniques

comment.narrative: 25-06-2021: Community was not been reached yet due to the mobility and gathering restrictions during 2020. Work has concentrated in the partners of the consortium. It will be possible once situation is normal to reach populations. The implementation of the investment and the construction of the Centre for Innovation and Resource-Smart Green Technologies will facilitate the contact with farmers and the training.

title.narrative: A.O.12. Number of organisations with policies and procedures to ensure an environment which is conducive for minorities

comment.narrative: 25-06-2021: ISPM already has a Gender Policy and Strategy. IIAM has started the strategy process by developing a list of ideas that will become part of their Gender Strategy that also considers minorities, this will be followed up.

title.narrative: A.O.6. Number of facilities established/strengthened

comment.narrative: 25-06-2021: Investment plan for the ISPM, IAC and IIAM is in place now, as part of the business plan development for the Resource centers. Implementation will take place in year 2.

title.narrative: A.E.1. Number of (knowledge) institutions supported directly

comment.narrative: 25-06-2021: The activities developed have involved staff from the 3 organizations making part of the project: Instituto Superior Politécnico de Manica (ISPM), Instituto de investigação Agrária de Moçambique (IIAM) and Instituto Médio Técnico-Profissional Agrário de Chimoio (IMTPAC).

title.narrative: A.O.2. Number of organisations revised/developed and implemented a strategic plan

comment.narrative: 25-06-2021: The focus in this project was the development of strategic/business plans for the resource centers and not focus on the total organization, because that is out of the scope of the project. The plans for ISPM, IAC and IIAM are available now for further implementation.

title.narrative: A.R.2. Number of relevant publications (level, gender, inclusion)

comment.narrative: 25-06-2021: The following documents are done: • Labour market assessment: the Inventory of needs (training) Co-created with the technicians and researchers of the institutes. • Gender need assessment report of ISPM, IIAM and IMTPAC There was an e-learning scan assessment but the Incubator assessment was postponed for 2021.

title.narrative: A.S.2. Number of MoUs or other types of collaboration agreements signed (education, private, public, surrounding community)

comment.narrative: 25-06-2021: There are MOU’s with many organizations to provide workplace training. In Mozambique, ISPM has signed collaboration agreement with IIAM and IMTPAC. Additional collaboration agreements signed include: a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between ISPM and ETG for the productions of different agricultural crops within ISPM production unit, which will contribute to operationalise the Centre for Innovation and Resource-Smart Green Technologies. A Momorandum of Understanding between ISPM and FSDMoç for the provision of financial services, which will increase the capacity of the ISPM incubation center to provide services to the community, to promote self-employment and entrepreneurship. Moreover, ISPM and Lúrio University (UniLurio) have agreed to expand their existing collaboration into other areas, which would enable the involvement of Lúrio University in activities of the project OKP-MOZ-104294, particularly in aspects regarding pilot testing and demonstrations of the innovations. In order to operationalise this, ISPM and Lúrio University will sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU).

title.narrative: FNS.2.1. Number of family farms (sub-sector, male/female, age: % < 35) with increased productivity and/or income

comment.narrative: 02-07-2021: Not applicable yet.

Smallholders generally live on less than 2$ a day (WorldBank) 92% of small- and medium-scale farmers in Mozambique do not have access to extension service (iDE) 95 % do not use fertilizers or pesticides (iDE) 90 % do not irrigate their crops; and 97 % do not have access to credit (iDE).
